title: Different behavior of variable sort and tensor sort.
body_html:
import torch
x = torch.randn(10)
y = torch.autograd.Variable(x)

y.sort(descending=True)
x.sort(descending=True)

Got error when executing last line.

TypeError: sort received an invalid combination of arguments - got (descending=bool, ), but expected one of:

  • ()
    didn't match because some of the keywords were incorrect: descending
  • (int dim)
  • (int dim, bool descending)

torch version 0.2.0_1

import torch

y = torch.autograd.Variable(x)

y.sort(descending=True)
x.sort(descending=True)

Got error when executing last line.

()
didn't match because some of the keywords were incorrect: descending
(int dim)
(int dim, bool descending)


torch version 0.2.0_1
body:
```
import torch
x = torch.randn(10)
y = torch.autograd.Variable(x)

y.sort(descending=True)
x.sort(descending=True)
```

Got error when executing last line.

> TypeError: sort received an invalid combination of arguments - got (descending=bool, ), but expected one of:
>  * ()
>       didn't match because some of the keywords were incorrect: descending
>  * (int dim)
>  * (int dim, bool descending)

torch version 0.2.0_1
